alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Houston; Madison; Montgomery; Walker; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 7:20PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Burleson, Grimes, eastern Brazos, northeastern Washington, northwestern Montgomery, southwestern Houston, Madison and western Walker Counties through 745 PM CST... At 719 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Wixon Valley to 8 miles southeast of Kurten to 7 miles north of Brenham. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern College Station, Brenham, Navasota, Madisonville, Austonio, Washington, Bedias, Millican, Anderson, Normangee, Iola, Independence, North Zulch, Roans Prairie, Richards and Carlos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brazos; Burleson; Grimes; Houston; Madison; Montgomery; Walker; Washington
